image.altText: Police vehicles by the side of the road.

props.synopsis: The suspected gunman — 56-year-old Porepunkah man Dezi Freeman — has been on the run since Tuesday after entering alpine bushland on foot, and is believed to be heavily armed.

title.children: No sightings of alleged Porepunkah gunman as manhunt enters day three

props.synopsis: Accused Porepunkah gunman Dezi Freeman's commenting history on Instagram shows a strong resistance to police authority, including mentioning dead and incinerated police.

title.children: 'Only good cop is a dead cop': What Dezi Freeman's online posts reveal

image.altText: Two men standing side by side in bulletproof vests with a white car behind them.

props.synopsis: Russia's desire to take Donbas from Ukraine is so strong they are using troops on motorbikes as cannon fodder, and as they do this, Ukrainians are in a race against time to save civilians.

title.children: 'Suicide bikes': Russia's kamikaze tactics to take Donbas

image.altText: hero

props.synopsis: An ABC NEWS Verify investigation has found organisers linked to the March for Australia protests sharing white supremacy posts on social media and, in one case, pro-Nazi and pro-Hitler memes.

title.children: March for Australia website referenced white nationalist 'remigration'

image.altText: the tail of a Qantas Boeing 767

props.synopsis: Qantas reports a 28 per cent rise in net profit to $1.6 billion in the last financial year, as strong travel demand boosts earnings across domestic and international.

title.children: Breaking: Qantas profit leaps 28 per cent to $1.6 billion

image.altText: An older Aboriginal man wearing a red headband.

props.synopsis: The family of Kumanjayi White, a young Warlpiri man who died in May after plain-clothes police restrained him in an Alice Springs supermarket, sues the NT government for damages.

title.children: 'Messed with the wrong family': Relatives sue over police restraint death

image.altText: A woman wearing glasses and a light blue top speaks to journalists.

props.synopsis: Former senator Linda Reynolds has won her defamation case against her ex-staffer, Brittany Higgins, but the emotional and financial toll of the three-year legal battle has been immense for both women.

title.children: Reynolds vindicated in defamation battle against Higgins, but at what cost?

image.altText: Anthony Albanese

props.synopsis: There is bipartisan support for expelling the Iranian ambassador and listing the IRGC as a terrorist organisation, but no end to the political brawl over antisemitic attacks in Australia.

title.children: The government takes swift action on Iran but the Coalition maintains the rage

image.altText: A mother hugging her son out the front of a school building.

props.synopsis: The shooting unfolded as children attended an initiation Mass on the third day of school since returning from summer holidays.

title.children: Minneapolis school shooting a 'hate crime targeting Catholics,' says FBI

image.altText: Leigh Read sitting on his desk

props.synopsis: Moving an individual's super out of funds that invest in fossil fuels is a popular climate action in Australia, but what is less common is entire organisations making the shift.

title.children: Employers switching super funds to send climate message

image.altText: solar panels.

props.synopsis: The Powering Skills Organisation warns the current energy workforce of 300,000 energy, gas and renewables sector workers will not be sufficient to meet demand and further investment in training will be needed

title.children: Net zero transition at risk of stalling amid shortfall of 42,000 workers

image.altText: A star logo and the words "'THE STAR" on the side of a high-rise building.

props.synopsis: It's the last roll of the dice for what was once one of the country's biggest casino groups, as yet another dispute with exasperated bankers delays a potentially lifesaving deal.

title.children: Bally's wish upon Star weighed down by debt

image.altText: Displaced Palestinians sit in the back of a truck with their belongings as they head south out of Gaza City.

props.synopsis: Israel's military has begun the next phase of the war — Operation Gideon's Chariots II. Some fear it could be even more deadly and devastating.

title.children: The takeover of Rafah last year could hint at what's next in Gaza City

image.altText: Deputy Prime Minister Richard Marles in profile.

props.synopsis: The Pentagon has denied Deputy Prime Minister Richard Marles and US Defence Secretary Pete Hegseth had a meeting during his trip to Washington this week. Follow live.

title.children: Pentagon denies Marles and Hegseth meeting, says it was a 'happenstance encounter'

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Pentagon denies Marles had a meeting with Hegseth
Paterson says Coalition offered govt bipartisan support to list IRGC as terrorist group
Coalition's listing of Hezbollah, Hamas as terrorist groups came down to evidence: Wilson

image.altText: Nvidia logo and rising stock graph are seen in this illustration

props.synopsis: US shares traded modestly higher ahead of Nvidia's profit results, but the chipmaker slipped in after-hours trade despite meeting expectations. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: US shares edge up as Nvidia profit meets expectations

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Qantas pays special dividend on bumper profit
Qantas posts 28% jump in profit to $1.61 billion
Wesfarmers profit surges to more than $2.9 billion

image.altText: Man stands in kitchen holding coffee cup

props.synopsis: Property owners at a Darwin apartment complex have each had to find at least $50,000 to pay a body corporate special levy, leaving many in financial difficulty.

title.children: 'Cost me a fortune': NT man sells apartment for loss after strata nightmare

image.altText: A young woman wearing a graduation ceremony cap, her face turned away from the camera.

props.synopsis: The visa changes could affect up to 1.6 million international students and about 355,000 exchange visitors.

title.children: Trump administration to tighten visa rules for students and media

image.altText: A young fan waves a pride flag at an AFLW game.

props.synopsis: Mitch Brown's history-making announcement he is bisexual has had an enormous impact on AFL fans, especially those in the LGBTQIA+ community.

title.children: AFL fans speak about the impact of Mitch Brown's brave announcement

image.altText: A young Sef Gonzales in a suit, being led by a funeral director through a crowd with flowers, outside a church setting.

props.synopsis: Convicted Sydney triple murderer Sef Gonzales has earned the right to appeal his sentence two decades after killing his parents and sister after "a doubt" was cast over his life sentence.

title.children: Sydney triple murderer wins right to appeal life sentence

image.altText: A middle aged white man in a suit looks to the side at the NATO summit

props.synopsis: Denmark's foreign minister summons a senior US diplomat for talks following reports at least three people with connections to US President Donald Trump have been carrying out covert influence operations in Greenland.

title.children: Denmark summons US envoy over suspected influence operations in Greenland

image.altText: Image of a middle aged man and woman smiling.

props.synopsis: Dementia researchers are calling for changes to the way one of the most common forms of younger-onset dementia is diagnosed, arguing current guidelines are overly restrictive and could delay access to treatment and clinical trials.

title.children: Younger-onset dementia patients missing out on timely diagnosis

image.altText: A blonde woman in a green jumper and a girl in a pink jumper hugging on a couch

props.synopsis: Centacare's plan to withdraw its NDIS-funded disability services by the end of the year is expected to affect hundreds of clients and about 600 jobs.

title.children: Hundreds of clients and employees to be affected by disability service closure

image.altText: USA women's rugby player Ilona Maher is wearing a black cutout dress and flexes her muscles, smiling, while holding a trophy

props.synopsis: Sponsors have not always flocked to women's sport, or targeted female fans, but they are now realising the potential of reaching women, and embracing femininity in sport.

title.children: Why big name beauty brands are cashing in on women in sport

image.altText: Jarrod Witts celebrates the final goal of the match for the Gold Coast Suns

props.synopsis: From Gary Ablett to Noah Anderson and Matt Rowell, from Guy McKenna to Damien Hardwick, it's been a long, long road to September football for the Gold Coast Suns. Andrew McGarry looks back on the journey for the 18th and last AFL team to clinch finals.

title.children: From Ablett to Anderson — the Suns' long road to the AFL finals

image.altText: Nicola Olyslagers clenches her fists and smiles after winning the high jump in front of the Zurich Opera House.

props.synopsis: Nicola Olyslagers confirms her status as perhaps Australia's greatest gold medal chance at next month's athletics world championships with her fourth Diamond league victory of the year.

title.children: Olyslagers wins latest duel with high jump rival ahead of world champs

image.altText: Three women huddle around two phones looking at them and speaking to each other behind face masks

props.synopsis: The move to ban the ubiquitous devices from classrooms received bipartisan support from MPs, who passed the bill on Wednesday.

title.children: South Korea bans mobile phones in classrooms nationwide

image.altText: A woman throws her hands up as she's covered in tomato juice and fruit in the middle of a crowd also covered in tomatoes

props.synopsis: It was the 80th rendition of the famous La Tomatina fight, which takes over the Spanish village of Buñol every August.

title.children: Thousands join in annual tomato food fight in Spain

image.altText: Ryan Hipwood surfing large wave at Shipstern Bluff in Tasmania.

props.synopsis: Sure, the water may not be as warm as other places, but if you like big waves, Tasmania's unique conditions deliver for surfers, the BOM's Luke Johnston says.

title.children: Australia's most southern state a prime hotspot for surfing, BOM says

image.altText: A man and woman walking together under cover of building. Man in white button up shirt and tie, woman in white lace top.

props.synopsis: When faced with the "terrifying" prospect that he might be blamed for the death of his friend and co-star, Matt Wright sought to stop any investigation "in its tracks", jurors in his criminal trial have heard.

title.children: Matt Wright's friends treated jurors 'like a bunch of muppets', Crown claims

image.altText: Police cars around a bus on a road

props.synopsis: Police confirm a girl was killed and at least nine other children were injured when a bus carrying nearly 30 private school students rolled just west of Geelong on the Hamilton Highway.

title.children: 'Confronting scenes' as girl killed in school bus rollover west of Melbourne

image.altText: Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook looking serious in a wood-paneled corridor.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump says he wants Lisa Cook removed from the board of the US central bank "immediately" but the economics professor is refusing to go, saying he has no power to remove her and, if he tries, she will sue.

title.children: Why does Trump want to remove Lisa Cook from the Fed?
